dict.string: Though no birth records exist, church records indicate that he was baptized in Stratford-upon-Avon on April 26, 1564.
His father was a glove maker and wool merchant, and his mother was the daughter of a well-known landowner.
His parents are believed to have been illiterate, but he learned to read English and Latin at the local school.
At the age of 18, he married Anne Hathaway, who was 8 years his senior and the daugter of a local farmer.
His only son Hamnet died at the age of 11, and in King John, he depicted a mother frantic over the loss of her son.
As a new actor in London, he had such a flair on the stage that he was described as an "upstart crow."
He started a play company called King's Men with his partners and they performed many of his plays in London.
He built the Globe Theatre, and owned other real estate, which supported him so he had uninterrupted time for writing.
He worked in London most of the year, returning home to visit his family once a year during Lent.
At the age of 52, he died after signing his will, which he began by describing himself as being in "perfect health."
He bequeathed his "second-best bed" to his wife, perhaps because the best bed was by custom reserved for guests.
There is no record of his activities between 1585 and 1592, but some think he was fleeing prosecution for deer poaching.
